item.title: about
item.description: These notes are supplements to STAT-UB 103, an introductory course in probability, statistics, and regression modeling. We use R to teach the course. The first three notes give a pithy introduction to R programming. Feedback is most welcome—please get in touch or submit a pull request. Made in collaboration with Joshua Loftus. Here is the syllabus. Theme inspired by Tufte Handouts. References and further reading Introductory: Diez, Ã‡etinkaya-Rundel, Barr, OpenIntro Statistics Illowsky, Dean.
